definitions.definition: the grey or black powder that is left after something, especially tobacco, wood or coal, has burnt

examples.text: Ash from the volcano fell over a wide area.
She flicked ash out of the window carelessly.

definitions.definition: what is left after something has been destroyed by burning

examples.text: The town was reduced to ashes in the fighting.
the glowing ashes of the campfire
The fire had died to cold ashes.
The party had risen, like a phoenix, from the ashes of electoral disaster.
She had seen all her dreams turn to ashes.

definitions.definition: the powder that is left after a dead person’s body has been cremated (= burned)

examples.text: She wanted her ashes to be scattered at sea.

definitions.definition: a forest tree with grey bark
the hard pale wood of the ash tree
the letter æ, used in Old English, and as a phonetic symbol to represent the vowel sound in cat
to behave in a way that shows that you are sorry for something that you have done

wordOrigin: senses 1 to 3 Old English æsce, aexe, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch as and German Asche.senses 4 to 5 Old English æsc, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch es and German Esche.
